intro: Leptochilus normalis, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and linear. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments. Leptochilus normalis is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to cold climates.
